plan.title: Metadata collected during the research and planning phases before the interview

fields.name: Description of supplemental materials
fields.description: Description and / or quantity of any additional materials given by interviewee or gathered during the research / interview process. Can include field notes and other preparatory materials used for research by interviewers. Can be open for public use or closed.

fields.name: Intended audience
fields.description: Was a specific audience intended by creators of the interview?

fields.name: Interviewee biographical history info
fields.description: Personal, educational, service, occupational, professional history of interviewee. Any of these categories could be broken out within a customized controlled vocabulary or retained in narrative form. For example: hometown, place of birth, organizations affiliated with

fields.name: Interviewer / interviewee connection
fields.description: How were the interviewer and interviewee brought together? Notes about how they know each other. For example: student interviewer matched with elder whose language she can speak fluently

fields.name: Interviewer preparation
fields.description: How the interviewer prepared for the interview including notes about training; for example, their research prior to the interview and sources consulted, topical/question lists

fields.name: Interviewer selection process
fields.description: Background information on selection and onboarding process for interviewer(s)

fields.name: Organizations supporting interview process
fields.description: Organizations that played any number of roles in the interview process (funders, staffing, research support, etc)

fields.name: Purpose
fields.description: Any information about why the interview or project happened; could be where "About this Project" information is captured.

fields.name: Reason for selection of this interviewee
fields.description: For example: the alumni office solicited an interview for a homecoming event

fields.name: Researcher contact info
fields.description: The person who completed research in preparation for the interview. Could be subfields: Phone Number, E-mail Address, Institutional Affiliation, Mailing Address & Social Media Handle.

fields.name: Researcher name
fields.description: The person who completed research in preparation for the interview. Could be subfields: Full Name, Alternate Name

fields.name: Sponsor/funder contact info
fields.description: Could be subfields: Phone Number, E-mail Address, Institutional Affiliation, Mailing Address & Social Media Handle

fields.name: Sponsor/funder name
fields.description: Full Name, Alternate Name

fields.name: Stakeholder notes and questions
fields.description: Repeatable, inclusive field for information that is being communicated (written, verbally) from stakeholders during all stages of the interview lifecycle. This could include questions from before the interview, interviewee instructions, transcriber questions, proper wording, etc.

fields.name: Additional Information about interview recording room
Age of interviewee at time of interview
Age of interviewer at time of interview
Compensation details for anyone involved in interview
fields.description: For example: interviewees receiving a .wav file of their interview recording or an intern earning class credit for her role as interviewer

fields.name: Copyright holder contact info
fields.description: Could be subfields: Phone Number, E-mail Address, Institutional Affiliation, Mailing Address & Social Media Handle

fields.name: Copyright holder name
fields.description: Could be subfields: Full Name, Alternate Name

fields.name: Duration (recording)
fields.description: For example: 1 hours and 30 minutes,01: 30: 00

fields.name: Existence of release form
fields.description: Can be interview agreement, release form, consent form, deed of gift, or other legal form

fields.name: Family members of interviewee contact info
fields.description: For example: Genealogical research. Could be subfields: Phone Number, E-mail Address, Institutional Affiliation, Mailing Address & Social Media Handle.

fields.name: Family members of interviewee names
fields.description: For example: Genealogical research. Could be subfields: Full Name, Alternate Name

fields.name: Funding story for interview
fields.description: Any additional information about funding or support for this interview or project

fields.name: Gender of interviewee
fields.description: Consider input from interviewee when assigning identity labels, even years after the interview was conducted

fields.name: Interview date
fields.description: For example: month, day, year

fields.name: Interview location
fields.description: Could be geolocation, GPS coordinates, street addresses etc. Consider privacy issues; administrative information

fields.name: Interview recording method
fields.description: Could indicate audio or video recording. Could also document multiple camera positions or other recording setups. For example: moving image or sound recording

fields.name: Interview time
fields.description: For example: 2 pm

fields.name: Interviewee contact info
fields.description: Could be subfields: Phone Number, E-mail Address, Institutional Affiliation, Mailing Address & Social Media Handle

fields.name: Interviewee name
fields.description: Could be subfields: Full Name, Alternate Name

fields.name: Interviewee condition
fields.description: Observable and/or self-reported behaviors and state of being, including emotional, mental, physical, circumstantial. Note of caution: subjective behavioral observations can be sensitive when publicly available.

fields.name: Interviewee date of birth
fields.description: Consider privacy issues; administrative information

fields.name: Interviewer contact info
fields.description: Could be subfields: Phone Number, E-mail Address, Institutional Affiliation, Mailing Address & Social Media Handle

fields.name: Interviewer name
fields.description: Could be subfields: Full Name, Alternate Name

fields.name: Interviewer condition
fields.description: Observable and/or self-reported behaviors and state of being, including emotional, mental, physical, circumstantial. Note of caution: subjective behavioral observations can be sensitive especially when publicly documented.

fields.name: Interviewer date of birth
fields.description: Consider privacy issues; administrative information

fields.name: Next of kin of interviewee
fields.description: For rights management, consider privacy: Legal representative of interviewee after their death. Could be subfields: Full Name, Phone Number, E-mail Address, Institutional Affiliation, Mailing Address, Alternate Name, & Social Media Handle.

fields.name: Others present at the interview contact info
fields.description: Could be subfields: Phone Number, E-mail Address, Institutional Affiliation, Mailing Address & Social Media Handle

fields.name: Others present at the interview name
fields.description: Could be subfields: Full Name, Alternate Name

fields.name: Original recording media count
fields.description: Quantities and inventories of physical media used to record interview or tracks created as part of a whole interview in the case of digital recordings. For example: 2 cassette tapes or five 15-minute .wav tracks, 2.00 hour analog reel-to-reel tape. Repeatable if there are multiple media types or formats.

fields.name: Original recording media type
fields.description: For example: open-reel tape, Sony miniDV tape, Sandisk SD card, etc.

fields.name: Quality of audio
fields.description: Overall quality of acoustics during interview. Might be used primarily in field notes to capture any technical or disruptive environmental acoustics; also covers notes about equipment

fields.name: Race of interviewee
fields.description: Consider input from interviewee when assigning identity labels, even years after the interview was conducted

fields.name: Recording conditions
fields.description: Any additional information about possible disruptions or noise during the recording; for example: telephone quality, coughing, machinery, etc.

fields.name: Recording equipment used
fields.description: Make and model of recording equipment, hardware, supplies (example: recording device, microphones, cameras, etc)

fields.name: Regional dialect of interviewee
fields.description: Could also include accent information

fields.name: Regional dialect of interviewer
fields.description: Could also include accent information

fields.name: Relationship of observer in the room to the interviewee
fields.description: For example: daughter of interviewee

fields.name: Relationship of recording location to its participants
fields.description: Consider privacy issues; this field could be in conjunction with "Interview Location" element for example: interviewee's home, interviewer's office, etc.

fields.name: Religion of interviewee
fields.description: Consider input from interviewee when assigning identity labels, even years after the interview was conducted

fields.name: Technicians in the room contact info
fields.description: Could be subfields: Phone Number, E-mail Address, Institutional Affiliation, Mailing Address & Social Media Handle

fields.name: Technicians in the room name
fields.description: Could be an audio producer, videographer, lighting technician, etc. Could be subfields: Full Name, Alternate Name.

fields.name: Translator contact info
fields.description: Could be subfields: Phone Number, E-mail Address, Institutional Affiliation, Mailing Address & Social Media Handle

fields.name: Translator name
fields.description: Could provide translation during interview or afterward during processing. Could be subfields: Full Name, Alternate Name

process.title: Metadata concerning the work done on the interview

fields.name: Accession date
fields.description: Date materials formally accessioned

fields.name: Archival processing location
fields.description: Repeatable if there are multiple locations for various formats and interview components; for example: audio editing, cataloging, transcript, etc)

fields.name: Audio / video editor contact info
fields.description: Could be subfields: Phone Number, E-mail Address, Institutional Affiliation, Mailing Address & Social Media Handle

fields.name: Audio / video editor name
fields.description: Could be subfields: Full Name, Alternate Name

fields.name: Captioner contact info
fields.description: Could be subfields: Phone Number, E-mail Address, Institutional Affiliation, Mailing Address & Social Media Handle

fields.name: Captioner name
fields.description: Could be subfields: Full Name, Alternate Name

fields.name: Cataloger contact info
fields.description: Could be subfields: Phone Number, E-mail Address, Institutional Affiliation, Mailing Address & Social Media Handle

fields.name: Cataloger name
fields.description: Could be subfields: Full Name, Alternate Name

fields.name: Condition of media
fields.description: For all physical and digital materials associated with the interview. For example: note of sticky shed observed on magnetic tape, proprietary digital formats in need of migration, age of optical media storage

fields.name: Correction / Redaction notes
fields.description: Could be note of changes made to recordings or to supplementary materials such as transcriptions. For example: interviewee reveals private medical info during interview and then asks for it to be redacted from the record

fields.name: Date interview discovered in collections
fields.description: For materials found in storage locations that haven't previously been described or inventoried

fields.name: Description of group of interviews
fields.description: Context for interviews (who organized, interviewer[s], research questions, when and where interviews took place, part of a larger event, etc)

fields.name: Digital storage location (derivative materials)
fields.description: Repeatable if there are multiple materials. Could be transcripts, indices, tape logs, captions, etc. For example: server, folder names

fields.name: Digital storage location (metadata)
fields.description: Does not include transcript as metadata. For example: server, folder names

fields.name: Digital storage location (supplemental materials)
fields.description: For example: server, folder names

fields.name: Digitizer contact info
fields.description: The person or company who did the digitization work. Could be subfields: Phone Number, E-mail Address, Institutional Affiliation, Mailing Address & Social Media Handle.

fields.name: Digitizer name
fields.description: The person or company who did the digitization work. Could be subfields: Full Name, Alternate Name

fields.name: Donation date
fields.description: Date materials arrived or transferred

fields.name: Donation story
fields.description: Any additional information about circumstances and backstory (provenance) of the acquisition of materials (example: retiring professor donating tapes to the repository years later); use this space to describe/capture the circumstances, especially if that process was complex, such as interviews passing through many different owners' hands.

fields.name: File name(s)
fields.description: Repeatable if there are multiple materials. For all physical and digital materials associated with the interview. Could be applied at item or collection level.

fields.name: Groups/organizations mentioned during the interview contact info
fields.description: Could be subfields: Phone Number, E-mail Address, Institutional Affiliation, Mailing Address & Social Media Handle

fields.name: Groups/organizations mentioned during the interview names
fields.description: Could be subfields: Full Name, Alternate Name

fields.name: Index
fields.description: Could be used to indicate the existance of an index, or to store the index content.

fields.name: Index type
fields.description: For example: Tape log, audio log, abstract, proper word form, OHMS index, question list or subject index

fields.name: Indexer contact info
fields.description: Repeatable if more than one indexer. Could be subfields: Phone Number, E-mail Address, Institutional Affiliation, Mailing Address & Social Media Handle

fields.name: Indexer name
fields.description: Repeatable if more than one indexer. Could be subfields: Full Name, Alternate Name

fields.name: Intent vs. Outcome
fields.description: For example: This would be the place to capture circumstances where a researcher's/interviewer's original agenda was X, but there is a gap of what actually was discussed, yet Y is still interesting enough to preserve the interview.

fields.name: Interview summary
fields.description: Narrative description of interview content. Could be formatted as an abstract.

fields.name: Languages (derivative materials)
fields.description: Repeatable if there are multiple translations. Could be transcripts, indices, tape logs, captions, etc. For example: Spanish and English transcriptions available.

fields.name: Method used for accession
fields.description: Description of process used for transfer/deposit between parties of interview, metadata, and supplementary materials.

fields.name: Name of group of interviews
fields.description: Project or series as defined by the institution. For example, a series of 10 interviews with the same interviewee

fields.name: Name of controlled vocabulary used
fields.description: For example: LoC, Regional, etc.

fields.name: Names/versions of software used
fields.description: Software used at any point in the production or preservation of interview; for example: DAMS, editing software

fields.name: New knowledge
fields.description: For any additional information discovered or gleaned retrospectively about the project origins, this is a space to add more context. For example: a relative finds an oral history transcript online and contacts repository to share information, or a crowdsourced comment sheds light on a project. Having a dedicated "why" field for this seems more manageable than fitting it into a notes field with other non-related information.

fields.name: Number of interviews in group
fields.description: Amount within a project or series as defined by the institution. For example, a series of 10 interviews with the same interviewee.

fields.name: Objects referenced in interview
fields.description: For example: photographs, maps, etc.

fields.name: Original media digital storage location (recording)
fields.description: For example: server, folder names

fields.name: Original media format
fields.description: For example: .wav, .mp4

fields.name: Original media storage location (recording)
fields.description: Repeatable if there are multiple locations for various formats and interview components

fields.name: Original storage location (derivative materials)
fields.description: Repeatable if there are multiple materials. Could be transcripts, indices, tape logs, captions, etc. For example: server, folder names

fields.name: Original storage location (supplemental materials)
fields.description: For example: server, folder names

fields.name: People mentioned during the interview contact info
fields.description: Could be subfields: Phone Number, E-mail Address, Institutional Affiliation, Mailing Address & Social Media Handle

fields.name: People mentioned during the interview name
fields.description: Person who prepared interviews for future research; might be multiple people at multiple stages; might not be "archivist," but could be. Could be subfields: Full Name, Alternate Name

fields.name: Person who processed the interview contact info
fields.description: Person who prepared interviews for future research; might be multiple people at multiple stages; might not be "archivist," but could be. Could be subfields: Phone Number, E-mail Address, Institutional Affiliation, Mailing Address, & Social Media Handle

fields.name: Person who processed the interview name
fields.description: Could be subfields: Full Name, Alternate Name

fields.name: Preservation copy format (derivative materials)
fields.description: Repeatable if there are multiple materials. Could be transcripts, indices, tape logs, captions, etc. For example: .PDF, .TIFF

fields.name: Preservation copy format (supplemental materials)
fields.description: Any additional materials given by interviewee or gathered during the research / interview process. Can include preparatory materials used for research by interviewers. Can be open for public use or closed.

fields.name: Preservation copy storage location (supplemental materials)
fields.description: Repeatable if there are multiple locations for various formats and interview components

fields.name: Preservation master media digital storage location (recording)
fields.description: For example: server, folder names

fields.name: Preservation master storage location (derivative materials)
fields.description: Repeatable if there are multiple materials or locations. Could be transcripts, indices, tape logs, captions, etc. For example: server, folder names.

fields.name: Preservation methods
fields.description: Methods used to capture, process, or move interviews into a preservation environment. For example: baking tapes, descriptions of physical storage evironments, processing workflows

fields.name: Processing hardware used
fields.description: Repeatable for names and/or models of hardware used in the processing or preservation of interview; for example: transcription pedals, scanners, digitization decks

fields.name: Processing milestone dates
fields.description: For example: "date interview recording received," "date captions added," "date draft transcript sent to interviewee," "date signed consent form received by archives," etc.

fields.name: Processing software used
fields.description: Repeatable for names and/or versions of software used at any point in the processing or preservation of interview; for example: DAMS, editing and captioning software

fields.name: Subjects discussed
fields.description: For example: historic events, social movements, subcultures, individuals, organizations, places (geolocation, GPS coordinates, street addresses etc.), including geographic places explored during interview (i.e., neighborhood tours); any of these categories could be broken out within a customized controlled vocabulary or retained in narrative form

fields.name: Title of interview
fields.description: Name given to the interview, could contain series info

fields.name: Topical date range
fields.description: Could be narrative or numeric description; for example, "1960s" or "This interview took place 10 years after X event"

fields.name: Total number of interviews at institution
fields.description: All interviews across all groups

fields.name: Transcriber contact info
fields.description: Could be subfields: Phone Number, E-mail Address, Institutional Affiliation, Mailing Address & Social Media Handle

fields.name: Transcriber name
fields.description: Could be subfields: Full Name, Alternate Name

fields.name: Transcript
fields.description: Could be used to indicate the existance of a transcript, or to store the transcript content

fields.name: Transcript editor contact info
fields.description: Could be subfields: Phone Number, E-mail Address, Institutional Affiliation, Mailing Address & Social Media Handle

fields.name: Transcript editor name
fields.description: Could be subfields: Full Name, Alternate Name

fields.name: Unique identifier
fields.description: Could be alpha or numeric, could accomodate local vocabularies and naming conventions

disseminate.title: Metadata concerning access of interview materials

fields.name: Access copy digital storage location (recording)
fields.description: For example: server, folder names

fields.name: Access copy format (derivative materials)
fields.description: Repeatable if there are multiple materials. Could be transcripts, indices, tape logs, captions, etc. For example: .PDF, .TIFF

fields.name: Access copy format (recording)
fields.description: Could include mezzanine higher quality access copies as well as public facing/user access copies

fields.name: Access copy format (supplemental materials)
fields.description: Any additional materials given by interviewee or gathered during the research / interview process. Can include preparatory materials used for research by interviewers. Can be open for public use or closed.

fields.name: Access copy storage location (derivative materials)
fields.description: Repeatable if there are multiple materials or locations. Could be transcripts, indices, tape logs, captions, etc. For example: server, folder names.

fields.name: Access copy storage location (recording)
fields.description: Repeatable if there are multiple locations for various formats and interview components

fields.name: Access copy storage location (supplemental materials)
fields.description: Repeatable if there are multiple locations for various formats and interview components

fields.name: Date made open for research
fields.description: Repeatable (for instance if the transcript becomes available earlier than the audio recording); also known as embargo date

fields.name: Derivative works citing the interview
fields.description: For example: citations for documentaries, articles, or live performances

fields.name: Digital storage size
fields.description: Could be size of an individual file such as an access copy of an interview, or all files associated with an interview or group of interviews.

fields.name: Format migration process
fields.description: Additional information about migration circumstances and processes implemented

fields.name: Holder of preservation copies contact info
fields.description: Organization or individual. Could be subfields: Phone Number, E-mail Address, Institutional Affiliation, Mailing Address & Social Media Handle.

fields.name: Holder of preservation copies name
fields.description: Could be subfields: Name and Alternate Name of organization or individual

fields.name: Length (derivative materials)
fields.description: For example: page count or word count of transcripts, indices, tape logs, captions, etc.

fields.name: Location of materials on the web (URL)
On-site access info
fields.description: Could be location or hours of operation. For example: reading room

fields.name: Preferred citation
fields.description: Wording required for a citation, or simply the repository location; could also be an acknowledgement statement

fields.name: Process for digital verification
fields.description: Description of process, including use of check sums, file naming conventions, decision trees, backup infrastructure

fields.name: Publisher contact info
fields.description: Could be subfields: Phone Number, E-mail Address, Institutional Affiliation, Mailing Address & Social Media Handle

fields.name: Publisher name
fields.description: Could be subfields: Full Name, Alternate Name

fields.name: Related resources
fields.description: Names and locations of related archival resources, published materials, exhibitions, etc. This could be within or beyond the interview's respository

fields.name: Repository
fields.description: Could be organizational information, institutional description, location information, or reference to the name of a repository represented in an online portal. Could be used in conjunction with "On-Site Access Info" element.

fields.name: Restriction conditions
fields.description: Use and access instructions from the interviewee, administrators, copyright holder, repository, etc.

fields.name: Schedule for format migration and fixity verification
fields.description: Could be date of next activity or span of time between processes

fields.name: Terms of use (online and/or on-site)
fields.description: Restrictions requested by donor or based on institutional policy; licensing rules; rules for how/if data can be extracted/manipulated

fields.name: User of interview contact info
fields.description: Could be an individuals or organizations making use of the interview for the purposes of research, creative projects, etc. Could be subfields: Phone Number, E-mail Address, Institutional Affiliation, Mailing Address & Social Media Handle

fields.name: User of interview name
fields.description: Could be an individuals or organizations making use of the interview for the purposes of research, creative projects, etc. Could be subfields: Full Name, Alternate Name
